descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
Legal_St 476-0-20 "Law & Society", Spring 2016, Prof. Heather Schoenfeld

This seminar is designed to introduce graduate students in the social and behavior sciences and humanities to key theories and research traditions in the multidisciplinary fields of law and society and legal studies. We will read foundational texts that examine the relationship between law and society, the social and political context of law, the role of law in social change, and the power asymmetries of law. Students will learn core concepts in the field, including, the myth of rights, legal mobilization, legal consciousness, legal pluralism, legal endogeneity and legal translation. Empirical themes covered will depend on student interests. In addition, we will examine the empirical methods used by law and society scholars.
